We should create the necessary infrastructure to aid development, integration and testing of qooxdoo libraries such as those in the qooxdoo-contrib repository. Based on existing tools such as BATbuild and QxTest, the following tasks could be automated:
* Read each library's Manifest file and determine compatible qooxdoo versions * Run a lint check on the libraries' sources * Check if the libraries' file/folder structure conforms to defined conventions * Generate a repository API viewer containing each library's documentation * Check library documentation for completeness/errors * Build the libraries' demo applications, integrate/link them in the qooxdoo.org demo browser * Generate library test runner * Run automated tests on the generated components, sending reports to the library maintainers
Feel free to add ideas and suggestions for this topic.

Created a new tool (tool/admin/bin/repository.py) that can scan a given path for libraries based on the contrib skeleton, selecting specific libraries, such as those compatible with a given qooxdoo version.

Status update: The repository tool is now able to deal with non-standard repository structures, i.e. repositories containing libraries that aren't based on the contribution skeleton. It also allows running generator jobs against libraries. Library demos can be automatically built and integrated into a special version of the qooxdoo Demobrowser app ("contribDemobrowser").
Moving to 1.2 since I won't have the time to complete any more subtasks before the 1.1 release.
Moved to 1.3. This task isn't specific to any qooxdoo release, just for my personal bug lists.
*** Bug 1910 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Added a new option --store-issues to the repository tool (repository.py) in r23197: Errors encountered during job processing will be stored in a JSON file (issues.json in the current working directory).
Currently, the following types of issues are stored: * library manifest file could not be read * library manifest incomplete (no "info" section") * library has no readme file * multiple library version manifests use the same value for "version" * library version has no readme file * results of generate.py lint on the library version * errors while trying to build the Testrunner for a library version * errors while trying to build a demo
